cards.name: Gigimon
cards.effect2: [Your Turn] (Once Per Turn) When an opponent's Digimon is deleted, this Digimon gets +2000 DP for the turn.

cards.name: Agumon
cards.effect2: [When Attacking] When this Digimon attacks a player, it gets +2000 DP for the turn.
ruling: Q: I attack my opponent with this Digimon. If they block it with one of their Digimon, does this Digimon's effect activate?
A: Yes. The effect was activated before your opponent blocked it. (See more in Attack Resolution)

cards.name: Guilmon
cards.effect1: [Your Turn] If your opponent has a level 6 or higher Digimon in play, this Digimon can digivolve into a [Gallantmon] in your hand for a memory cost of 4, ignoring its digivolution requirements.
cards.effect2: [Your Turn] (Once Per Turn) When an opponent's Digimon is deleted, trigger <Draw 1> (Draw 1 card from your deck).
ruling: Q: If your Digimon with this card as a source and an opponent’s Digimon are deleted at the same time, can you activate this card’s inherited effect?
A: No. Before you can activate the effect this card is moved to the trash and is no longer in the battle area, so you cannot activate the effect

cards.name: Biyomon
cards.effect1:
<Blocker> (When an opponent's Digimon attacks, you may suspend this Digimon to force the opponent to attack it instead).
[Your Turn] This Digimon can't attack players.

cards.name: Growlmon
cards.effect2: [Your Turn] (Once Per Turn) When an opponent's Digimon is deleted, gain 1 memory.
ruling: Q: If your Digimon with this card as a source and an opponent’s Digimon are deleted at the same time, can you activate this card’s inherited effect?
A: No. Before you can activate the effect this card is moved to the trash and is no longer in the battle area, so you cannot activate the effect

cards.name: GeoGreymon
cards.effect1:
[Security] At the end of the battle, play this card without paying its memory cost.
[On Play] Delete 1 of your opponent's Digimon with 4000 DP or less.
engsets: Digimon Card Game Fest - Vault Set
ruling: Q: When this Digimon is played due to its [Security] effect is it counted as a Security Digimon?
A: No. At the point this Digimon is played via this effect it is considered to be a standard Digimon
Q: If this card is Security Checked and deleted in battle does is it still Played via its [Security] effect?
A: Yes. The outcome of the battle doesn’t matter, at the end of the battle the Digimon is Played

Q: When this card is Security checked and battled, if the attacking Digimon has further security checks to make, does this Digimon get Played or do those Checks occur first? Furthermore, what is the timing for the activation of this card’s [On Play] effect?
A: This Digimon is Played prior to the next Security Check. The [On Play] ability also activates as soon as the Digimon is Played, prior to the next Security Check
Q: This card is played via its [Security] effect. The attacking Digimon has DP4000 or less but has <Jamming>. Can you use this Digimon’s [On Play] effect to delete the attacking Digimon?
A: Yes. You may delete the attacking Digimon

cards.name: RizeGreymon
cards.effect1: [On Play] Delete 1 of your opponent's Digimon with 5000 DP or less.

cards.name: WarGrowlmon
cards.effect1: [When Attacking] Delete 1 of your opponent's Digimon with 3000 DP or less.
cards.effect2: [Your Turn] (Once Per Turn) When an opponent's Digimon is deleted, this Digimon gains <Security Attack +1> (This Digimon checks 1 additional security card).
ruling: Q: A Digimon with this card as a source and the <Piercing> effect attacks an opposing Digimon and only the opposing Digimon is deleted. Does the inherited effect of this card grant the attacking Digimon <Security Attack +1> for the ensuing Security Checks granted by <Piercing>?
A: Yes. It does

cards.name: Gallantmon
cards.effect1:
<Security Attack +1> (This Digimon checks 1 additional security card)
[When Attacking] Delete 1 of your opponent's Digimon with 4000 DP or less. If no Digimon was deleted by this effect, this Digimon gets +3000 DP for the turn.
engsets: PB-08: Digimon Card Game Playmat and Card Set 1 -Digimon Tamers-
ruling: Q: This card’s [When Attacking] ability reads, ‘Delete an opponent’s Digimon with DP4000 or less. If an opponent’s Digimon is not deleted by this effect,’ What does this mean?

A: This refers to a situation in which there are no opposing Digimon that can be deleted by this Digimon’s [When Attacking] effect, such as if your opponent does not have a Digimon with DP 4000 or less or if they only have Digimon that cannot be deleted by effect
Q: If my opponent has a Digimon with DP 4000 or less, can I choose not to delete that Digimon to give this Digimon DP +3000?

A: No. If this card’s [When Attacking] effect is activated and there is an opposing Digimon with DP 4000 or less you must target that Digimon. If there is an appropriate target for the effect you may not choose to not target it.

Q: If my opponent has two Digimon with DP 4000 or less, one which cannot be deleted by opponent’s effects and one that can, can I target the Digimon that cannot be deleted by opponent’s effects, fail to delete it, and then give this Digimon DP +3000?
A: Yes. You may choose any opposing Digimon with DP 4000 or less. You may deliberately choose a Digimon that cannot be deleted by opponent’s effects to force the deletion to fail.

cards.name: ShineGreymon
cards.effect1:
<Security Attack +1> (This Digimon checks 1 additional security card).
<Piercing> (When this Digimon attacks and deletes an opponent's Digimon and survives the battle, it performs any security checks it normally would).

cards.name: Lightning Joust
cards.effect1: [Main] 1 of your Digimon gets +2000 DP for the turn. Then, if the number of cards in your security stack is less than or equal to your opponent's, 1 of your Digimon gains <Security Attack +1> (This Digimon checks 1 additional security card) for the turn.
cards.effect2: [Security] Add this card to its owner's hand.
ruling: Q: Upon using this card you and your opponent have the same number of Security Cards remaining, but then later in the turn your opponent’s number of Security Cards decrease, leaving you with more. Does the <Security Attack +1> granted by this card disappear at that time?
A: No. So long as your number of Security Cards remaining is equal or fewer than your opponent’s at the time of Use, you don’t lose the effect even if your opponent’s Security decreases later

cards.name: Atomic Blaster
cards.jpname: アトミックブラスター
cards.effect1: [Main] Choose any number of your opponent's Digimon whose total DP adds up to 8000 or less and delete them.
ruling: Q: The card reads, 'Choose any number of your opponent's Digimon whose total DP adds up to 8000 or less'. What does that actually mean?

A: Choose any number of your opponent’s Digimon so that the total DP of those Digimon adds up to 8000 or less, such as a DP 3000 Digimon and a DP 5000 Digimon, or two DP 2000 Digimon and a DP 3000 Digimon, and then activate the effect on those Digimon
Q: Can I deliberately choose fewer targets so that the total DP is less than 8000?
A: Yes. You are free to choose so long as the total DP is 8000 or less. However, you must choose at least 1 Digimon if your opponent has any Digimon with DP 8000 or less

Q: If my opponent has [BT4-066 Golemon] and I include Golemon as one of the targeted Digimon my opponent’s other Digimon’s DP will be reduced by 1000 when Golemon is Deleted. Can I include that loss of DP in my calculations when selecting Digimon to target?
A: No. Your opponent’s Digimon’s DP will only be reduced after Golemon is Deleted when this card’s effect has finished activating. You may not choose an additional target at that point
Q: Can this card’s [Main] effect be stacked with "Add 1000 to the maximum DP you can choose with DP-based deletion effects" to make it able to delete a Digimon with 11000 DP or lower?
A: Yes.
